questions.question: Which chart type is best for showing parts of a whole?
questions.explanation: Pie charts display proportions of a whole as slices of a circle.

questions.question: What type of plot shows the relationship between two continuous variables?
questions.explanation: Scatter plots display individual data points to reveal correlations between variables.

questions.question: Which visualization shows the distribution of data across quartiles?
questions.explanation: Box plots display median, quartiles, and potential outliers in a dataset.

questions.question: What is the most popular Python library for data visualization?
questions.explanation: Matplotlib is the foundational plotting library in Python for creating static visualizations.

questions.question: Which chart type is best for showing trends over time?
questions.explanation: Line charts connect data points to show changes and trends over continuous intervals.

questions.question: What visualization displays the correlation between multiple variables as colored cells?
questions.explanation: Heatmaps use color intensity to represent values in a matrix format.

questions.question: Which library builds on Matplotlib with a higher-level interface?
questions.explanation: Seaborn provides attractive statistical graphics with simpler syntax than Matplotlib.

questions.question: What type of chart compares values across categories using rectangular bars?
questions.explanation: Bar charts use horizontal or vertical bars to compare categorical data.

questions.question: Which visualization combines box plot and kernel density information?
questions.explanation: Violin plots show the distribution shape along with quartile information.

questions.question: What library is used for creating interactive web-based visualizations?
questions.explanation: Plotly creates interactive, publication-quality graphs that work in web browsers.
